intro: Hubertia ivohibeensis, commonly known as the Ivohibeensis hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
